item.title: 全球股票基金创十多年来最大单周流入量
item.description: 截至11月13日的一周内，全球股票基金创下了十多年来最大的单周净购买量，原因是投资者乐观地认为，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）决定性的连任将促进企业盈利并推动美国经济增长。【原文：Global equity funds saw the largest weekly net purchases in over a decade in the week to Nov. 13, driven by investor optimism that a decisive second-term mandate for Donald Trump would bolster corporate earnings and fuel U.S. economic growth.】

item.title: 美国在特朗普回国前敲定授予台积电 66 亿美元芯片合同
item.description: 美国商务部周五表示，已敲定向台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department said Friday it has finalized a $6.6 billion government subsidy for Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co's U.S. unit for semiconductor production in Phoenix, Arizona.】

item.title: 花旗集团警告特朗普的政策可能会减缓新兴市场的增长
item.description: 花旗集团分析师预计，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）最近赢得美国总统大选后，新兴市场股票的表现将逊于全球同行，尽管中国最近采取了一些政策措施，全球经济也在增长。【原文：Citigroup analysts anticipate that emerging market stocks will underperform compared to global peers following Donald Trump's recent victory in the U.S. presidential election, despite China's recent policy initiatives and global economic growth.】

item.title: 投资者围观特朗普贸易的全球市场受害者
item.description: 全球大型投资者正在退出那些押注美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的税收和关税政策将提振华尔街并给海外市场造成破坏的热门交易，转而投向 11 月 5 日大选中一些最大的市场受害者。【原文：Big global investors are exiting popular trades that bet on U.S. President-elect Donald Trump’s tax and tariff policies boosting Wall Street and wreaking damage abroad and swooping in on some of the Nov. 5 election's biggest market victims.】

item.title: 三星电子计划回购 72 亿美元以提升股东价值
item.description: 三星电子在周五收盘后提交的一份监管文件中表示，该公司计划在一年内回购价值 10 万亿韩元（71.7 亿美元）的股票，以提升股东价值。【原文：Samsung Electronics plans to buy back shares worth 10 trillion won ($7.17 billion) over a one-year period to boost shareholder value, it said in a regulatory filing submitted after the market closed on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道：信中称，脆弱国家将在 COP29 上推动 200 亿美元的气候融资
item.description: 路透社看到的一封信显示，一些受冲突影响的国家正在COP29会议上推动将财政援助增加一倍，达到每年200多亿美元，以应对这些国家的人民所面临的自然灾害和安全危机。【原文：A group of conflict-affected countries is pushing at COP29 to double financial aid to more than $20 billion a year to combat the natural disaster and security crises facing their populations, a letter seen by Reuters showed.】

item.title: 交易员在美国期权市场追逐大选后的股票涨幅
item.description: 美国股市的期权交易者们正纷纷加大风险押注，支持美国股市在大选忧虑消退、共和党有望在明年锁定华盛顿权力的背景下反弹。【原文：Options players are piling in to riskier bets across the U.S. stock market, supporting a rally that has come on the back of fading election worries and expectations of a Republican lock on power in Washington next year.】

item.title: 健康倡导者要求 Cepheid 提供更便宜的 mpox 检测试剂盒
item.description: 全球健康倡导者已致函一种重要的水痘诊断检测试剂的制造商，呼吁将其价格从每次约 20 美元降至 5 美元，以帮助受病毒严重影响的贫困国家解决检测率低的问题。【原文：Global health advocates have written to the makers of a key mpox diagnostic test to call for its price to be cut from around $20 per test to $5, to help tackle low testing rates in poorer countries badly hit by the virus.】

item.title: 早间竞标中国消费者支出增加，但不是在房地产上
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 礼来起诉美国机构阻止药品回扣计划
item.description: 礼来公司周四表示，它起诉了联邦卫生资源与服务管理局（HRSA），指控其阻止该公司改变向医院提供药品折扣方式的计划。【原文：Eli Lilly said on Thursday it sued the federal Health Resources and Services Administration (HRSA) over allegedly blocking the company's plan to change the way it offers drug discounts to hospitals.】

item.title: 日本 10 月通胀可能放缓，出口回升：路透调查
item.description: 路透社周五的一项民意调查显示，由于能源价格增长放缓，日本10月份的核心消费通胀率可能连续第二个月下降。【原文：Japan's core consumer inflation likely cooled for the second straight month in October on slower growth in energy prices, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.】

item.title: 2025 年新增氧化铝供应有望打破价格涨势纪录
item.description: 将铝土矿转化为氧化铝的新产能将于明年投产，这将缓解供应紧张的局面，并有可能阻止用于制造铝的材料价格破纪录地上涨。【原文：New capacity for converting bauxite into alumina due online next year is set to ease tight supplies and potentially halt a record-breaking price rally of the material used to make aluminium.】

item.title: Netflix 希望通过保罗与泰森的比赛实现体育直播的突破
item.description: 前重量级拳王迈克-泰森（Mike Tyson）与社交媒体影响者杰克-保罗（Jake Paul）将于本周五进行对决，这是 Netflix 最新的一记重拳，这家媒体巨头希望在体育节目流媒体化的冲刺阶段从中获利。【原文：A showdown between former heavyweight champion Mike Tyson and social media influencer-turned-fighter Jake Paul on Friday is the latest one-two punch from Netflix, as the media giant hopes to cash in on sports' sprint to streaming.】

item.title: 加拿大劳工委员会命令蒙特利尔港口恢复运营
item.description: 加拿大劳资关系委员会（CIRB）命令蒙特利尔港从周六上午起恢复运营，该港口的雇主协会称，在联邦政府介入并指示劳资委员会结束港口纠纷后，蒙特利尔港恢复了运营。【原文：Canada's Industrial Relations Board (CIRB) ordered a resumption of operations at the Port of Montreal from Saturday morning, the port's employers association said, after the federal government stepped in and directed the labour board to end port disputes.】

item.title: 中国 10 月工业产值不及预期，零售额高于预期
item.description: 中国 10 月份的工业产值增速放缓，而零售额却意外上扬，这一系列数据好坏参半，凸显出尽管近期采取了一系列政策支持措施，但中国经济仍难以提速。【原文：China's industrial output grew at a slower pace in October, while retail sales surprised on the upside, a mixed set of data that underlined the economy's struggles to pick up speed despite a recent blitz of policy support measures.】

item.title: 中国房价创 9 年来最快降幅，但官员认为有企稳迹象
item.description: 中国 10 月份新房价格同比降幅创 2015 年以来之最，但月降幅收窄表明，在政府的大力支持下，房地产行业开始企稳。【原文：China's new home prices fell the most year-on-year in October since 2015, but a narrowing monthly rate of declines suggested the property sector was beginning to stabilise with a barrage of support from the government.】

item.title: 石油因供应过剩担忧而下挫，并走向周线跌势
item.description: 周五早盘，油价下跌，原因是供应过剩的担忧和美元走强带来的需求担忧超过了美国燃料库存的大幅减少。【原文：Oil prices edged down early on Friday as oversupply concerns and demand worries stemming from a stronger dollar outweighed a steep draw in U.S. fuel stocks.】

item.title: 鲍威尔推高收益率，美元站上一年高位，股市犹豫不决
item.description: 由于美联储主席的鹰派态度令短期国债收益率走高，美元周五早盘延续了广泛的涨势，高居一年来的高位，导致华尔街期货收红，亚洲多数市场陷入困境。【原文：The U.S. dollar extended its broad rally early on Friday, towering at one-year highs as a hawkish turn from the Federal Reserve chief sent short-term Treasury yields higher, leaving Wall Street futures in the red and most Asia markets struggling.】

item.title: 通用汽车自动驾驶部门 Cruise 承认提交虚假报告，将支付 50 万美元罚款
item.description: 美国司法部表示，通用汽车公司的自动驾驶汽车部门 Cruise 周四承认提交虚假报告以影响联邦调查，并将支付 50 万美元罚款，作为延期起诉协议的一部分。【原文：General Motors' self-driving car unit, Cruise, admitted on Thursday to submitting a false report to influence a federal investigation and will pay a $500,000 fine as part of a deferred prosecution agreement, the Justice Department said.】

item.title: 美联储放缓宽松政策，通胀前景看好，美元有望实现周度上涨
item.description: 受美联储降息次数减少的预期以及唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）1月份上任后其政策可能进一步刺激通胀的观点提振，美元周五创下了一个多月以来的最佳一周。【原文：The dollar was headed for its best week in more than a month on Friday, buoyed by expectations of fewer Federal Reserve rate cuts and the view that Donald Trump's policies could further stoke inflation when he assumes office in January.】

item.title: 报道称现代汽车将任命全球首席运营官何塞-穆诺兹（Jose Munoz）为首席执行官
item.description: 一则新闻报道援引未具名业内人士的话称，现代汽车将于周五晚些时候任命现任全球首席运营官何塞-穆诺兹（Jose Munoz）为新任首席执行官。【原文：Hyundai Motor will name Jose Munoz, the current global chief operating officer, as its new chief executive officer later on Friday, a news report said, citing unnamed industry sources.】

item.title: 日产汽车股价在报道激进投资者 Oasis 持股后大涨
item.description: 日本《钻石在线》杂志报道激进投资者绿洲管理公司（Oasis Management）已入股日产汽车公司后，日产汽车股价周五在东京早盘交易中一度跳涨达 6%。【原文：Nissan Motor shares jumped as much as 6% in early Tokyo trading on Friday after Japan's Diamond Online magazine reported that activist investor Oasis Management had taken a stake in the automaker.】

item.title: 日本第三季度经济按年率计算增长 0.9%，资本支出不温不火
item.description: 日本政府周五公布的数据显示，日本经济在7-9月份按年率计算增长了0.9%，由于资本支出不振，增速比前三个月有所放缓。【原文：Japan's economy expanded by an annualised 0.9% over the July-September quarter, government data showed on Friday, slowing from the previous three months due to tepid capital spending.】

item.title: 日本经济 7-9 月按年率计算增长 0.9
item.description: 日本政府周五公布的数据显示，日本经济在 7-9 月份按年率计算增长了 0.9%，而市场预测中值为增长 0.7%。【原文：Japan's economy expanded an annualised 0.9% in the July-September quarter, government data showed on Friday, compared with a median market forecast for a 0.7% increase.】

item.title: 美国男子因清洗比特币交易所（Bitfinex）黑客窃取的加密货币被判 5 年监禁
item.description: 纽约一名技术企业家去年承认在其妻子的帮助下清洗从全球最大的加密货币交易所之一 Bitfinex 窃取的资金，并于周四被判处五年监禁。【原文：A New York technology entrepreneur was sentenced to five years in prison on Thursday after pleading guilty last year to laundering funds stolen from Bitfinex one of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchanges, with the help of his wife.】

item.title: 百时美施贵宝因抗癌药延期上市再次面临 67 亿美元诉讼
item.description: 布里斯托尔-迈尔斯-施贵宝公司（Bristol Myers Squibb）周四遭到一项价值 67 亿美元的诉讼，声称该公司欺骗了前 Celgene 公司的股东，推迟了三种药物的联邦审批，而在此之前的 1 个半月，一名联邦法官突然驳回了该案的早期版本。【原文：Bristol Myers Squibb was hit on Thursday with a $6.7 billion lawsuit claiming it cheated former Celgene shareholders by delaying federal approval for three drugs, 1-1/2 months after a federal judge abruptly dismissed an earlier version of the case.】

item.title: 个人电脑制造商联想营收大增 24%，超出预期
item.description: 随着全球个人电脑产业出现复苏迹象，联想集团有限公司第二财季收入同比增长 24%。【原文：Lenovo Group Ltd posted a 24% rise in revenue in its fiscal second quarter from a year earlier, as the global personal computer industry showed signs of recovery.】

item.title: Glenview、Sachem Head、Third Point 在第三季度上市期间买入 CVS 股票
item.description: 据监管文件显示，三家知名投资公司押注陷入困境的医疗保健巨头 CVS Health 即将发生变化，并在第三季度增加了现有的押注，建立了新的头寸。【原文：Three prominent investment firms bet changes are in the offing at ailing healthcare giant CVS Health and added to existing bets and established a new position during the third quarter, according to regulatory filings.】

item.title: 美联储主席鲍威尔拒绝透露任期届满后是否留任
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔周四拒绝透露他是否会在2026年5月美联储主席任期届满后继续留任美国央行董事会成员。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Thursday declined to say whether he would remain at the U.S. central bank as a board member after his term as chief expires in May 2026.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 Woolworths 和 Coles 就折扣诉讼进行辩护
item.description: 伍尔沃斯公司（Woolworths）和科尔斯集团（Coles Group）周五表示，他们将为一家律师事务所在澳大利亚联邦法院提起的集体诉讼辩护，该诉讼涉及这两家杂货店涉嫌误导性折扣主张。【原文：Woolworths and Coles Group said on Friday they would defend class action proceedings commenced by a law firm in Australia's federal court over the grocers' alleged misleading discount claims.】
